title: @Produces(MediaType.SERVER_SENT_EVENTS) is necessary when using server side event
body:
### Describe the bug

According to the [documentation](https://quarkus.io/guides/resteasy-reactive#server-sent-event-sse-support) : 

_by using @RestStreamElementType, we don't need to add @Produces(MediaType.SERVER_SENT_EVENTS)_

But it's necessary when using `quarkus-rest-client-reactive-jackson` 

Here is the controller : 
````
 @GET
 @Blocking
 @RestStreamElementType(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
 @Path("/items")
  public Multi<Items> getPaginateItems() {
        return searchService.getAllItems();
    }
````

Here is the rest client :

````
@GET
@Path("/items")
@Produces(MediaType.SERVER_SENT_EVENTS)
Multi<Items> getPaginateItems();
````

As a workaround, we added  `@Produces(MediaType.SERVER_SENT_EVENTS)` in addition of `@RestStreamElementType(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)` in the server side.

### Expected behavior

Items are retrieved with status 200

### Actual behavior

When the rest client is used the following exception occures:

```
javax.ws.rs.NotAcceptableException: The accept header value did not match the value in @Produces
	at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.server.handlers.ClassRoutingHandler.handle(ClassRoutingHandler.java:136)
	at io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.server.runtime.QuarkusResteasyReactiveRequestContext.invokeHandler(QuarkusResteasyReactiveRequestContext.java:96)
	at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.core.AbstractResteasyReactiveContext.run(AbstractResteasyReactiveContext.java:145)
	at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.server.handlers.RestInitialHandler.beginProcessing(RestInitialHandler.java:48)
	at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.server.vertx.ResteasyReactiveVertxHandler.handle(ResteasyReactiveVertxHandler.java:23)
	at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.server.vertx.ResteasyReactiveVertxHandler.handle(ResteasyReactiveVertxHandler.java:10)
```



### How to Reproduce?

Steps to reproduce the error : 

1. Create an endpoint with `@RestStreamElementType(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)` and without `@Produces(MediaType.SERVER_SENT_EVENTS)`
2. Create a external service with a rest client that refers to this endpoint with `@Produces(MediaType.SERVER_SENT_EVENTS)`
3. The external service calls the endpoint

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

java version "19.0.1" 2022-10-18

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.16.4.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.6 

### Additional information

_No response_
